intro: Arachniodes hehaii, commonly known as the Hohai spider fern, is a species of evergreen fern native to China. It belongs to the family Davalliaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, intricate fronds that resemble spider webs, giving it its common name. The plant features a short, creeping rhizome with dense, clustered fronds that are typically dark green and leathery in texture. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in mountainous regions with high humidity. Due to its unique appearance and ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in specialty gardens and botanical collections.
